verses.roman:
sarva eva yajanti tvāṁ
sarva-deva-mayeśvaram
ye 'py anya-devatā-bhaktā
yady apy anya-dhiyaḥ prabho

synonyms: sarve—all; eva—indeed; yajanti—worship; tvam—You; sarva-deva—all the demigods; maya—O You who comprise; īśvaram—the Supreme Lord; ye—they; api—even; anya—of other; devatā—deities; bhaktāḥ—devotees; yadi api—although; anya—turned elsewhere; dhiyaḥ—their attention; prabho—O master.
translation: But all these people, my Lord, even those who have turned their attention away from You and are worshiping other deities, are actually worshiping You alone, O embodiment of all the demigods.

purport.content: The idea here is that even those who worship the demigods are indirectly worshiping the Supreme Lord Viṣṇu. The understanding of such worshipers, however, is imperfect.
